activities.loc: Br 2 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
All charges against Nathan C Goldsmith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan C Goldsmith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:28 PM Defendant Nathan C Goldsmith in court, in custody.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Nathan C Goldsmith.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Victim E.V. Appears by speaker phone.  Upon plea to Cts. 1, 2, 6, 8 and 9 the State would recommend 2 yr. IC and 3 yr. ES on Ct. 1, 2 and 6.  The State would recommend 3 yr. IC and 3 yr. ES, i/s, 2 yr. consecutive probation on Cts. 8 and 9.  BTC: Use of a dangerous weapon on Ct. 1 stricken.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  State is requesting a PSI. 

Plea:
21CF1225:
Ct. 1- GUILTY
Ct. 2- GUILTY
Ct. 6- GUILTY
Ct. 8- GUILTY
Ct. 9- GUILTY

BTC:

21CF1225:
Ct. 1- GUILTY

Ct. 6- GUILTY
Ct. 8- GUILTY
Ct. 9- GUILTY

ALL REMAINING COUNTS DRI.

Atty Erin Preston

**ENTERED IN ERROR BY SPD, DEFENDANT IS A CONFLICT FOR THE SPD OFFICE.  DEFENDANT HAS A COURT APPOINTED ATTORNEY ON 21CF1225.**

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim L.A (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
